title: 113_hr2866
content: The Act may be cited as the "Boys Town Centennial Commemorative Coin Act". Boys Town is a nonprofit organization founded in 1917 by Father Flanagan in Nebraska. It serves children of all races and religions and has expanded to provide care in 11 regions across the country. Father Flanagan's work gained global recognition after the success of the 1938 movie "Boys Town". Boys Town, founded in 1917 by Father Flanagan in Nebraska, now operates in 11 regions across the US, including California, Nevada, Texas, and New York. The Boys Town National Hotline counsels over 150,000 callers annually, while the Boys Town National Research Hospital leads in hearing care and Usher Syndrome research. Programs impact over 2 million children and families yearly, with the 100th anniversary of Boys Town approaching on December 12th, 2017. SEC. 3. COIN SPECIFICATIONS. The Secretary of the Treasury will mint and issue commemorative $5 gold coins, $1 silver coins, and half dollar clad coins in honor of the centennial of Father Flanagan's Boys Town. The coins will have specific weights, diameters, and metal compositions as outlined in the Act. The coins minted under this Act will have a diameter of 1.205 inches and be minted to the specifications for half dollar coins. They shall be legal tender and considered numismatic items. The design of the coins minted under this Act will symbolize Boys Town's 100 years, a prominent nonprofit child care agency in the US. Each coin will feature the coin's value, the year "2017", and inscriptions of "Liberty", "In God We Trust", "United States of America", and "E Pluribus Unum". The design will be chosen by the Secretary in consultation with Boys Town's National Executive Director and the Commission of Fine Arts, and reviewed by the Citizens of Coinage Advisory Committee. SEC. 5. ISSUANCE OF COINS. Coins minted under this Act will be issued in uncirculated and proof qualities at a single designated facility of the United States Mint. The Secretary is authorized to issue these coins only between January 1, 2017, and December 31, 2017. SEC. 6. SALE OF COINS. The coins will be sold by the Secretary at a price equal to the face value plus the cost of designing and issuing them. Bulk sales will be offered at a discount, and prepaid orders will be accepted with a reasonable discount. SEC. 7. SURCHARGES. Sales of coins under this Act will include surcharges: $35 for $5 coin, $10 for $1 coin, $5 for half dollar coin. Surcharges go to Boys Town for helping children and families in underserved communities. SEC. 8. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. SEC. 8. FINANCIAL ASSURANCES. The Secretary will ensure minting coins won't cost the government and no funds will be disbursed until all costs are recovered.
